items.description:
Hey Everyone,

It's Friday and that means 3 things. First, it's time for Weekly Xamarin. Second, it's the start of the weekend. And Third, the Xamarin Expert Day 2020 is happening right now and you should go check it out - https://expertday.forxamarin.com/

Thanks again to all the community for your amazing content.

Stay Safe, and have a great weekend.

❤

Kym

items.title: Xamarin.Forms 5 Preview: Advanced UI Controls for Beautiful Apps
items.description:
Xamarin.Forms 5 brings to stable release features that you have seen in preview over the latest several 4.x releases. This includes solid and gradient Brushes, CarouselView, drag-and-drop, RadioButton, Shapes, and SwipeView. These new features inject new creative potential for your application designs to create beautiful, interactive experiences.

Let’s look at those highlights, and then a quick checklist of what you should review as you get started with the Xamarin.Forms 5 pre-release.

Xamarin.Forms 5 Preview: Advanced UI Controls for Beautiful Apps by David Ortinau
items.description_markdown:
Xamarin.Forms 5 brings to stable release features that you have seen in preview over the latest several 4.x releases. This includes solid and gradient Brushes, CarouselView, drag-and-drop, RadioButton, Shapes, and SwipeView. These new features inject new creative potential for your application designs to create beautiful, interactive experiences.

Let’s look at those highlights, and then a quick checklist of what you should review as you get started with the Xamarin.Forms 5 pre-release.

[**Xamarin.Forms 5 Preview: Advanced UI Controls for Beautiful Apps**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/xamarin-forms-5-preview/) by [David Ortinau](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/author/davidortinau/)

embedded_links.title: **Xamarin.Forms 5 Preview: Advanced UI Controls for Beautiful Apps**

items.title: Building a Xamarin.Forms Moon Phase App
items.description:
One of the wonderful things about .NET is the vast array of platforms .NET developers can target. My personal experience has been developing ASP.NET applications and HTTP APIs, but recently I’ve been dabbling with mobile applications built using Rider and Xamarin.Forms.

Building a Xamarin.Forms Moon Phase App by Khalid Abuhakmeh
items.description_markdown:
One of the wonderful things about .NET is the vast array of platforms .NET developers can target. My personal experience has been developing ASP.NET applications and HTTP APIs, but recently I’ve been dabbling with mobile applications built using Rider and Xamarin.Forms.

[**Building a Xamarin.Forms Moon Phase App**](https://blog.jetbrains.com/dotnet/2020/09/25/build-a-xamarin-forms-moon-phase-app/) by [Khalid Abuhakmeh](https://blog.jetbrains.com/author/khalid-abuhakmeh)

items.title: Custom pop-up with MvvmCross the right way
items.description:
In this post Denys describes how to implement cross-platform, maintainable, and testable pop-ups using Xamarin and MvvmCross.

items.title: Replicating Sneakers UI in Xamarin Forms
items.description:
Leomaris tackles another UI in Xamarin.Forms. This one is for a sneakers store and involves some cool Xamarin.Forms Shapes controls.

items.title: Hunting Xamarin.Forms Shadows leaks on Android

items.title: Build pixel-perfect Microsoft Surface Duo apps with Uno Platform
items.description:
The Surface Duo has started to become available to developers and users alike so in this guest post, the team at Uno discuss how you can use the Uno Platform for your next Surface Duo app as well as how to test it and make the most of its unique design.

Build pixel-perfect Microsoft Surface Duo apps with Uno Platform by Agnès Zitte
items.description_markdown:
The Surface Duo has started to become available to developers and users alike so in this guest post, the team at Uno discuss how you can use the Uno Platform for your next Surface Duo app as well as how to test it and make the most of its unique design.

[**Build pixel-perfect Microsoft Surface Duo apps with Uno Platform**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/surface-duo/get-started-uno-platform/) by [Agnès Zitte](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/surface-duo/author/agneszittenventivecom/)

embedded_links.title: **Build pixel-perfect Microsoft Surface Duo apps with Uno Platform**

items.title: XamExpertDay 2020
items.description:
The XamExpertDay of 2020 is a free virtual event organized by the community, for the community. This all-day event is all about Xamarin, Xamarin.Forms and everything related to that. Tune in on October 2nd as we will have 9 speakers from all around the world providing you with deep-dive, expert content. Don't miss it!

XamExpertDay 2020 XamExpertDay 2020 by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
The XamExpertDay of 2020 is a free virtual event organized by the community, for the community. This all-day event is all about Xamarin, Xamarin.Forms and everything related to that. Tune in on October 2nd as we will have 9 speakers from all around the world providing you with deep-dive, expert content. Don't miss it!

items.title: .NET Conf 2020 and Community Events this October
items.description:
Virtually tune-in to communities around the world through amazing online events, streams, and recordings this October. Stay connected to your developer communities through the upcoming .NET Conf 2020, virtual Meetups, community stand-ups, podcasts, and more! As well as discovering ways to get started with .NET tutorials and hosting your own virtual experiences.

.NET Conf 2020 and Community Events this October by Jayme Singleton
items.description_markdown:
Virtually tune-in to communities around the world through amazing online events, streams, and recordings this October. Stay connected to your developer communities through the upcoming .NET Conf 2020, virtual Meetups, community stand-ups, podcasts, and more! As well as discovering ways to get started with .NET tutorials and hosting your own virtual experiences.

[**.NET Conf 2020 and Community Events this October**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/dotnet-conf-2020-community-events-october/) by [Jayme Singleton](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/author/jaymesingleton/)

items.title: Scribble Together with Bridger Maxwell
items.description:
Bridger Maxwell is the engineer behind Scribble Together - a collaborative drawing app. In this video he discusses general software architecture, networking, and drawing aspects of the app.

Scribble Together with Bridger Maxwell by How it's Built
items.description_markdown:
Bridger Maxwell is the engineer behind Scribble Together - a collaborative drawing app. In this video he discusses general software architecture, networking, and drawing aspects of the app.

items.title: A lot of Xamarin and a bit of MAUI with Gerald Versluis
items.description:
This week, Barry talks with Gerald Versluis about Xamarin. We talk about what Xamarin is and what you can do with it and how you can use it to build apps for lots of platforms like iOS and Android. We also touch on the future of Xamarin, which is .NET MAUI that will be released in the .NET 6 timeframe.

A lot of Xamarin and a bit of MAUI with Gerald Versluis by Developer Weekly Podcast
items.description_markdown:
This week, Barry talks with Gerald Versluis about Xamarin. We talk about what Xamarin is and what you can do with it and how you can use it to build apps for lots of platforms like iOS and Android. We also touch on the future of Xamarin, which is .NET MAUI that will be released in the .NET 6 timeframe.

[**A lot of Xamarin and a bit of MAUI with Gerald Versluis**](https://developerweeklypodcast.com/15/a-lot-of-xamarin-and-a-bit-of-maui-with-gerald-versluis) by [Developer Weekly Podcast](https://developerweeklypodcast.com)

embedded_links.title: **A lot of Xamarin and a bit of MAUI with Gerald Versluis**
